newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Hungary's forint closes steady vs dollar.
newsitem.headline: Hungary's forint closes steady vs dollar.

text.p: Hungary's forint moved in a narrow range in slow trade, following the dollar/mark cross, and closed almost unchanged against the dollar, dealers said on Friday.
"The forint followed the dollar/mark, which also moved in a narrow range during the trading in Hungary," Hypo-Bank's Zoltan Kalman said.

The forint moved around 151.40 to the dollar and closed at 151.38/43, or some five pips weaker than the National Bank of Hungary's (NBH) resistance level (bid), compared with its opening of 151.40/43.
The NBH bid firmed to 151.30 by 1225 GMT as the dollar eased against the mark, Kalman said.

The dollar mostly firmed in futures trading on the Budapest Commodity Exchange (BCE). Most mark futures dropped and the Ecu, which was the most actively traded currency on Friday, also eased for some of the maturities.
